name: Odin

about_section.description: Odin, the Allfather, is the ruler of Asgard and the overseer of fate. A seeker of knowledge and a master of war, he prepares warriors for the final battle of RagnarÃ¶k.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: Odin wields magic, prophecy, and wisdom. He sacrificed his eye for knowledge and discovered the runes through self-sacrifice, shaping the fate of gods and men.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Odin was honored through sacrificial rituals (BlÃ³ts), Viking rune magic, and the legendary Wild Hunt, a spectral army riding through the sky before war.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Odin intervenes in the lives of warriors and kings, guiding them toward wisdom or war. His legacy shapes Norse lore and the cosmic struggle of RagnarÃ¶k.

name: Loki
title: The Trickster, The Catalyst of Fate

core_identity.domain: Trickery, Chaos, Fire, Deception, Transformation, Mischief, Betrayal

about_section.title: Divine Order & Role in the Cosmos

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Unlike Odin and Thor, Loki had no historical temples. He was seen as a force of nature, an agent of change rather than a god of worship.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: Loki was once a friend to the Ã†sir, but his trickery and deception led to the downfall of the gods, making him Asgardâ€™s greatest enemy.

about_section.title: Divine Order & Role in the Cosmos
about_section.description: Freyja is a goddess of passion, magic, and war, wielding love and battle as equal forces. She rules over FÃ³lkvangr, claiming the bravest fallen warriors before Odin.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: Freyja is the greatest practitioner of seiÃ°r magic, teaching it to Odin himself. She represents fertility, gold, and the dual nature of love and war.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Freyja was widely worshiped across Viking lands, associated with beauty, prosperity, and fertility. Her influence remained even after Christianity spread.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: Freyja shares kinship with Freyr and Odin, but Loki constantly seeks to undermine her. Giants often lust after her, leading to abductions and conflicts.

about_section.description: Fenrir is not a god, but a force of nature, destined to bring about the end of the Ã†sir. Bound by fate, he will one day break free and consume Odin himself.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Fenrir was not worshiped, but Viking warriors respected his primal power, wearing wolf pelts and invoking his strength in battle.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: Fenrir shares blood ties with Loki, JÃ¶rmungandr, and Hel, but his greatest rival is Odin, the Allfather, whom he is fated to destroy.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Fenrir's legend endures as a symbol of inevitable fate, chaos, and the wild power that even gods cannot contain.
